item.title: Joe add a quote by Charles Dickens
Joe add a quote by Jonathan Franzen
item.description: "It was a way of recognizing places of enchantment: people falling asleep like this." -- Jonathan Franzen

item.title: Joe add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "A man inherited a field in which was an accumulation of old stone, part of an older hall. Of the old stone some had already been used in building the house in which he actually lived, not far from the old house of his fathers. Of the rest he took some and built a tower. But his friends coming perceived at once (without troubling to climb the steps) that these stones had formerly belonged to a more ancient building. So they pushed the tower over, with no little labour, and in order to look for hidden carvings and inscriptions, or to discover whence the man's distant forefathers had obtained their building material. Some suspecting a deposit of coal under the soil began to dig for it, and forgot even the stones. They all said: 'This tower is most interesting.' But they also said (after pushing it over): 'What a muddle it is in!' And even the man's own descendants, who might have been expected to consider what he had been about, were heard to murmur: 'He is such an odd fellow! Imagine using these old stones just to build a nonsensical tower! Why did not he restore the old house? he had no sense of proportion.' But from the top of that tower the man had been able to look out upon the sea." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Joe add a quote by William Carlos Williams
item.description: "Hold back the edges of your gown, Ladies, we are going through hell." -- William Carlos Williams

item.title: Joe add a quote by Yusef Komunyakaa
item.description: "I am this space my body believes in." -- Yusef Komunyakaa

item.title: Joe add a quote by Allen Ginsberg
item.description: "in my dreams you walk dripping from a sea journey on the highway across America in tears to the door of my cottage in the Western night" -- Allen Ginsberg

item.title: Joe add a quote by H.G. Wells
item.description: "This isn't a war," said the artilleryman. "It never was a war, any more than there's war between man and ants." -- H.G. Wells

item.title: Joe add a quote by Bruce Chatwin
item.description: "Sluggish and sedentary peoples, such as the Ancient Egyptians-- with their concept of an afterlife journey through the Field of Reeds-- project on to the next world the journeys they failed to make in this one." -- Bruce Chatwin

item.title: Joe add a quote by Bruce Chatwin
item.description: "To lose a passport was the least of oneâ€™s worries. To lose a notebook was a catastrophe" -- Bruce Chatwin

item.title: Joe add a quote by Bruce Chatwin
item.description: "Walking is a virtue, tourism is a deadly sin." -- Bruce Chatwin

item.title: Joe add a quote by Philip Roth
item.description: "In my childhood I led the life of a sage, when I grew up I started climbing trees" -- Philip Roth

item.title: Joe add a quote by Bruce Chatwin
item.description: "A journey is a fragment of Hell." -- Bruce Chatwin

item.title: Joe add a quote by Salman Rushdie
item.description: "She's no flibberti-gibberti mamzell, but a whir-stir-get-lost-sir bundla dynamite!" -- Salman Rushdie

item.title: Joe add a quote by Philip Roth
item.description: "Oh, to be a center fielder, a center fielder- and nothing more" -- Philip Roth

item.title: Joe add a quote by Robert Byron
item.description: "Somebody must trespass on the taboos of modern nationalism, in the interests of human reason. Business can't. Diplomacy won't. It has to be people like us." -- Robert Byron

item.title: Joe add a quote by Anton Chekhov
item.description: "Don't tell me the moon is shining; show me the glint of light on broken glass." -- Anton Chekhov

item.title: Joe add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "Definition of rock journalism: People who can't write, doing interviews with people who can't think, in order to prepare articles for people who can't read." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Joe add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "The first draft of anything is shit." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Joe add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "The purpose of writing is to inflate weak ideas, obscure poor reasoning and inhibit clarity." -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Joe add a quote by Philip Roth
item.description: "Everybody else is working to change, persuade, tempt and control them. The best readers come to fiction to be free of all that noise." -- Philip Roth

item.title: Joe add a quote by Philip Roth
item.description: "Is everyone to go off and lock the door and sit secluded like the lonely writers do, in a soundproof cell, summoning people out of words and then proposing that these word people are closer to the real thing than the real people that we mangle with our ignorance every day? The fact remains that getting people right is not what living is all about anyway. It's getting them wrong that is living, getting them wrong and wrong and wrong and then, on careful consideration, getting them wrong again." -- Philip Roth
